setInitialCapacity

void setInitialCapacity(int capacity)

getMaximumCapacity

int getMaximumCapacity()
Returns:
the maximum capacity for all caches

setMaximumCapacity

void setMaximumCapacity(int capacity)
Although the maximum capacity can be set to less than the initial capacity, this is really a waste. If any caches are larger than the new maxium capacity, then are immediately pared down to size.

Parameters:
capacity -

getCacheSize

int getCacheSize(java.lang.Class type)
Returns:
the size of the cache for the specified type. If no cache for that specific class exists, returns -1;

void clearCaches()
Removes all items from all caches.

isCacheInitialized

boolean isCacheInitialized(java.lang.Class c)
Returns:
true if a cache for the specified class is initialized; false otherwise.

Frees the resources associated with the cache for the specifed class.

Parameters:

releaseCaches

void releaseCaches(java.lang.Class[] cs)
Frees the resources associated with caches for the specified classes.

cache

java.lang.Class cache(java.lang.Object key,
                      java.lang.Object item)
Tries to cache this item under an appropriate class cache.

Returns:
the class under which the item was cached, or null if the item was not succesfully cached (because, for example, there is no cache of a compatible type)

cache

boolean cache(java.lang.Object key,
              java.lang.Object item,
              java.lang.Class type)
Where the actual caching occurs. Maintains the size of the cache less than maximum.

Returns:
true if the item was cached or was already in the cache; false if the cache doesn't exist or the item is not compatible with that cache type

retrieve

java.lang.Object retrieve(java.lang.Object key,
                          java.lang.Class type)
Tries to retrieve an item held under the specified key in the cache for the specified class.

Returns:
the object stored, or null if there is not object stored under that key in that cache, or the cache doesn't exist.
